snippet: A driver for Pablo Neruda, the Nobel-winning poet who died weeks after a coup ousting Salvador Allende, had alleged he was given a mysterious injection.
abstract: Chilean and international forensics experts rule out poisoning or other foul play in death of poet Pablo Neruda in 1973; inquiry was opened in 2011 after Neruda's former driver Manuel Araya claimed that doctor had injected Neruda with suspicious substance.
lead_paragraph: A driver for Pablo Neruda, the Nobel-winning poet who died weeks after a coup ousting Salvador Allende, had alleged he was given a mysterious injection.

headline.main: 40 Years On, No Foul Play Found in Chilean Poet’s Death
headline.print_headline: Chile: No Foul Play in Poet’s Death
